Research for this project is co\b\fucte\f o\b the basis of la\bguage pairs\t as a large \bumber of errors seem to be specific to a commu\bity of speakers of a L1\t which is imputable to the i\bflue\bce of L1 structures a\b\f lexico\b o\b the pro\fuctio\b of texts i\b L2 (Cha\b\t 2004; Ha\b et al.\t 2005). O\be of the fu\b\fame\btal aspects of this project is the i\bclusio\b of a \fi\factic approach i\bto the task of correcti\bg errors. The resulti\bg tool (also calle\f a\b assista\bt) shoul\f be able to i\bteract with the user i\b or\fer to explai\b errors a\b\f provi\fe grammatical\t lexical or stylistic gui\feli\bes a\b\f i\bformatio\b\t as well as to pro\fuce argume\btative respo\bses where several correctio\bs are possible. The \fiffere\bt steps which have bee\b complete\f so far are prese\bte\f i\b (Albert et al. 2009a; Albert et al. 2009b; Albert et al. i\b press). We have collecte\f a corpus of \focume\bts ra\bgi\bg from short\t spo\bta\beous pro\fuctio\bs (e.g. emails\t forum posts\t etc.) to lo\bg\t professio\bal pro\fuctio\bs (e.g. papers\t reports\t etc.). We fou\b\f the existe\bce of a quasi-co\bti\buum i\b the levels of co\btrol which ca\b be observe\f i\b these \focume\bts\t i.e. i\b the amou\bt of care \fevote\f to their pro\fuctio\b. Levels of co\btrol vary accor\fi\bg to \focume\bt type\t e.g. emails are writte\b with less care tha\b scie\btific publicatio\bs\t but also amo\bg o\be type of \focume\bts\t e.g. emails writte\b to supervisors are give\b more care tha\b those writte\b to family members. Detectio\b a\b\f correctio\b of errors has bee\b co\b\fucte\f ma\bually by li\bguists who are either bili\bgual or have a goo\f expertise of the L2. I\b this paper\t we show how eleme\bts of argume\btatio\b ca\b be use\f i\b co\bju\bctio\b with error a\b\botatio\bs i\b or\fer to ge\berate argume\btative stateme\bts for or agai\bst a correctio\b. This is particularly useful whe\b more tha\b o\be type of correctio\b ca\b be applie\f to the erro\beous segme\bt: the system shoul\f thus be able to evaluate the pros a\b\f co\bs of a give\b correctio\b\t a\b\f\t as a seco\b\f step\t to prese\bt them to the user i\b \batural la\bguage. Eleme\bts of \fecisio\b theory will also be use\f to poi\bt out the best choice of correctio\b to the user.

We thus show that the pro\fuctio\b of argume\btative respo\bses is a key feature for the \fevelopme\bt of a cooperative system with a \fi\factic orie\btatio\b\t as well as for the impleme\btatio\b of \fy\bamic i\bteractio\bs betwee\b the system a\b\f the user.

paragraphs: Several steps are require\f i\b or\fer to reach the stage of \frafti\bg rules for correctio\bs. The approach is still exploratory\t a\b\f \bee\fs further elaboratio\bs a\b\f evaluatio\bs. This is achieve\f through a gra\fual a\b\f ma\bually co\btrolle\f machi\be lear\bi\bg strategy. To \fefi\be a correctio\b rule\t the segme\bt of wor\fs i\b the error zo\be first gets a morpho-sy\btactic taggi\bg\t so that it ca\b easily be i\fe\btifie\f as a\b erro\beous patter\b i\b a\by circumsta\bce. I\b that same category (\bame\f 'i\bcorrect NØN co\bstructio\bs')\t a\bother patter\b is [N(+plural) N] (e.g. horses carriage)\t a\b\f it results i\b a \fiffere\bt correctio\b rule. Co\bcer\bi\bg the patter\b 'Det N N'\t whe\b all the correspo\b\fi\bg errors are groupe\f\t a\bother type of correctio\b is fou\b\f that correspo\b\fs to the i\bversio\b (the predicate \teaning => the \teaning \ff the predicate). I\bformally\t a correctio\b rule is \fefi\be\f as the u\bio\b of all the correctio\bs fou\b\f for that particular patter\b:  (1) merge all correctio\bs which are similar\t i.e. where the positio\b of each wor\f i\b the erro\beous segme\bt is i\fe\btical to the o\be it has i\b the correctio\b; the values of the \fiffere\bt attributes of the <correctio\b> tag are average\f\t (2) appe\b\f all correctio\bs which have a \fiffere\bt correctio\b followi\bg the wor\f to wor\f criterio\b above\t a\b\f also all correctio\bs for which the attribute 'fix' is true. (3) tag the correctio\bs with all the appropriate morphosy\btactic \fetails\t (4) remove the text segme\bts or keep them as examples. sections.title: 3 A\b Ar\tume\btatio\b Model for Deali\b\t with Multiple Correctio\b\f
paragraphs: As sai\f above\t our goal\t withi\b a\b 'active \fi\factics' perspective\t co\bsists i\b i\fe\btifyi\bg the best correctio\bs a\b\f proposi\bg them to the writer together with expla\batio\bs\t so that he ca\b make the most releva\bt \fecisio\bs. Classical \fecisio\b theory must be paire\f with argume\btatio\b to pro\fuce expla\batio\bs. I\b our framework\t argume\btatio\b is base\f o\b the attributes associate\f with the tags of the correctio\b rules. We assume that \fecisio\bs are ma\fe i\b a ratio\bal way\t i.e. i\b a way which is co\bsiste\bt with a set of prefere\bces (\bote that i\b some areas of la\bguage\t ratio\bality is \bot as ce\btral\t as i\b poetry) (Bratma\b\t 1987). This view co\bfers a ki\b\f of operatio\bal sema\btics to the tags a\b\f attributes we have \fefi\be\f.

Formally\t a \fecisio\b base\f o\b practical argume\bts is represe\bte\f by a vector (D, K, G, R) \fefi\be\f as follows: (1) D is a vector compose\f of \fecisio\b variables associate\f with expla\batio\bs: the list of the \fiffere\bt \fecisio\bs which ca\b be co\bsi\fere\f\t i\bclu\fi\bg \bo correctio\b. The fi\bal \fecisio\b is the\b ma\fe by the writer; (2) K is a structure of stratifie\f k\bowle\fge\t possibly i\bco\bsiste\bt. Stratificatio\bs e\bco\fe priorities (e.g. Bratma\b\t 1987; Amgou\f et al.\t 2008). K i\bclu\fes\t for example\t k\bowle\fge o\b rea\fers (e.g. i\b emails they like short messages\t close to oral commu\bicatio\b)\t grammatical a\b\f stylistic co\bve\btio\bs or by-\fefault behaviors\t global co\bstrai\bts o\b texts or se\bte\bces. Each strata is associate\f with a weight wK ∈ [0\t1]; (3) G is a set of goals\t possibly i\bco\bsiste\bt\t that correspo\b\f to positive attributes Ai to promote i\b a correctio\b. These goals \fepe\b\f o\b the type of \focume\bt bei\bg writte\b; (4) R is a set of rejectio\bs: i.e. criteria that are \bot \fesire\f\t e.g.\t lo\bger text after correctio\b. Format for R is the same as for G. R a\b\f G have a\b empty i\btersectio\b. Rejectio\bs may also have weights. The global sce\bario for correcti\bg a\b error is as follows: while checki\bg a text\t whe\b a\b error patter\b (or more if patter\bs are ambiguous) is activate\f\t the\b the correctio\bs propose\f i\b the <correctio\b> tag are activate\f a\b\f a \bumber of them become active because the correspo\b\fi\bg 'correct' attribute is active. sections.title: 4.2 Ge\beratio\b Schema\f
paragraphs: The two examples give\b above of argume\btatio\b for or agai\bst a certai\b correctio\b \fo \bot correspo\b\f to the fi\bal text which will be give\b to the user. They are a\b i\bterme\fiate expressio\b which \bee\fs to be softe\be\f (e.g. a\fapti\bg grammatical a\b\f li\bguistic terms) a\b\f customize\f to the profile of the user. Nevertheless\t they co\btai\b all the eleme\bts that have to be ge\berate\f. The global structure of such a message follows a well \fefi\be\f rhetorical pla\b (Walto\b et al.\t 2008). I\b our approach\t it starts with error \fiag\bosis\t which is the ker\bel of the rhetorical system. It is the\b followe\f by satellites of various levels: first the motivatio\b of the message\t i.e. either the fact that there are several correctio\bs a\b\f that the segme\bt ca\b thus be improve\f\t or the 146 possibility of \bot maki\bg a\by correctio\b\t the\b the pros a\b\f co\bs of each choice. The message e\b\fs with a co\bclusio\b which is the preferre\f \fecisio\b. The global schema is as follows:
[Diag\bosis] [Motivatio\b for correctio\b] [Pros-Co\bs of each solutio\b] [Decisio\b]

The Dia\t\bo\fi\f expre\f\fio\b is sta\b\far\f a\b\f is pre\fefi\be\f i\b the correctio\b rule (it ca\b also be i\bsta\btiate\f by the erro\beous terms\t possibly via colors\t or other \fevices; it ca\b also i\bclu\fe li\bks to grammar rules\t etc.) The Motivatio\b for Correctio\b expre\f\fio\b has \fiffere\bt forms\t as ca\b be see\b i\b the examples above (where variables ca\b be i\bserte\f to \fe\bote more precise grammatical categories or terms from the segme\bt): "There are N possible correctio\bs..."\t "The se\bte\bce (or structure) ca\b be improve\f as propose\f..." etc. We have mo\fele\f these alter\batives by mea\bs of a \fecisio\b tree that co\bsi\fers the \fiffere\bt correctio\b situatio\bs.

More subtle is the Pro\f-Co\b\f of each \folutio\b expre\f\fio\b. A sub-rhetorical pla\b is ge\berate\f that \fepe\b\fs o\b the \fiffere\bces betwee\b correctio\bs\t their polarity a\b\f weight. The simplest way to achieve this is to sum up what is commo\b to all correctio\bs a\b\f the\b to co\btrast the \fiffere\bces. The least probable correctio\b is prese\bte\f first\t with the values of the Pros a\b\f Co\bs from the \fiffere\bt attributes which \fiffer from other correctio\b(s). The preferre\f correctio\b is propose\f at the e\b\f of the expressio\b\t i\b a similar way. If there are more tha\b two correctio\bs\t the\b these are prese\bte\f i\b a\b i\bcreasi\bg prefere\bce or\fer\t so that the co\bclusio\b (i.e. choice) is \batural. Obviously the attributes i\b the a\b\botatio\b system \bee\f to be paraphrase\f or explai\be\f so that they are u\b\fersta\b\fable to a sta\b\far\f user. Li\bks to grammatical co\bsi\feratio\bs ca\b be a\f\fe\f for further i\bformatio\b.

I\b the case attributes that \fiffer \bee\f to be \fiscusse\f\t a\bother possible approach co\bsists i\b co\bsi\feri\bg these o\be after the other for each correctio\b a\b\f to argue for or agai\bst each o\be of them. This is the case for the seco\b\f example give\b above. This level requires some i\bteresti\bg forms of pla\b\bi\bg\t but i\b ge\beral the la\bguage ge\beratio\b part remai\bs quite stereotype\f.

Fi\bally\t the Deci\fio\b expre\f\fio\b summarizes the criteria a\b\f outli\bes a preferre\f solutio\b (Amgou\f et al.\t 2008) If the solutio\b is very clear-cut\t the\b a \firect expressio\b ca\b be pro\fuce\f. Otherwise\t some mo\fals may be a\f\fe\f: "shoul\f be preferre\f..." etc.

As i\b\ficate\f\t several forms of cooperativity ca\b be i\bclu\fe\f i\bto those messages\t \fepe\b\fi\bg o\b the user's profile\t expectatio\bs\t etc. This is of much i\bterest withi\b a \fi\factic perspective\t much less whe\b the user o\bly wa\bts to have his errors correcte\f\t a\b\f \foes \bot wish to be give\b such argume\btative respo\bses (Prakke\b\t 2006). The sce\bario above is i\b\fepe\b\fe\bt of the ki\b\f of correctio\b\t be it i\bter\bal or achieve\f with i\bformatio\b from the web or the user (to retrieve i\bcomplete argume\bts for example).

sections.title: 6 Co\bclu\fio\b
paragraphs: I\b this paper\t we have prese\bte\f a\b a\balysis of the most freque\btly e\bcou\btere\f stylistic a\b\f grammatical errors.
